snippet: Israeli Arabs have experienced a political awakening as politicians have formed potent alliances that hold the potential of preventing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from cobbling together a ruling coalition.
abstract: New political alliance between Israel's Arab political parties, which has energized many of nation's 1.7 million Palestinian citizens, threatens to shift dynamics in upcoming election; polls show that alliance could become its third-largest Parliamentary faction, with 13 of 120 seats, giving leader Ayman Odeh potential to block Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu or his chief challenger Isaac Herzog in their pursuit of a ruling coalition.

byline.contributor: Gabby Sobelman contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Said Ghazali from Umm el-Fahm and Iksal, Israel.

lead_paragraph: Israeli Arabs have experienced a political awakening as politicians have formed potent alliances that hold the potential of preventing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from cobbling together a ruling coalition.

headline.main: Arab Alliance Rises as Force in Israeli Elections
headline.print_headline: Arab Alliance Rises as Force in Israel Vote
